contentitemdata.kenticocommunity.qandaqu.QAndAQuestionPageContent:
[describe your problem or question]
---
**Environment** - Xperience by Kentico version: [28.4.4] - .NET version: [8] - Deployment environment: [SaaS|Azure|VM] - Hi, I'm trying to run CD on a published site.
`dotnet run --no-build --kxp-cd-restore --repository-path ".\App_Data\CDRepository\"` produces the error > Couldn't find a project to run. Ensure a project exists in E:\sites\dancingGoat, or pass the path to the project using --project.
`dotnet run --no-build --kxp-cd-restore --repository-path ".\App_Data\CDRepository\" --project "DancingGoat.dll` produces >'DancingGoat.dll' is not a valid project file.
Is source code required on a target server to restore CD?
**Environment** - Xperience by Kentico version: [29.0.1] - .NET version: [8] - Deployment environment: localLink to relevant [Xperience by Kentico documentation](https://docs.kentico.com)
contentitemdata.kenticocommunity.qandaqu.QAndAQuestionPageTitle: Is source code required on target server to run CD restore?
